Text: We partner with third party advertising companies to manage our advertising on the InMarket Applications. Because we enable these third parties on the InMarket Applications, we may be considered to have sold data to these third parties over the past 12 months.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Sold

Text:
1. Sources of Personal Information Collected

Information from You

You may provide information manually while using our Services, for example, by typing your name and email address or by using a social profile to register for or update an account in one of the InMarket Applications. Some InMarket Applications invite you to link to your banking or payment card accounts and your retail shopping accounts (such as your online store user account or a store loyalty account). We also collect personal information when you communicate with us for support or any other reason or when you register for a promotion.

Information from our Services

Our Services may collect personal information through the InMarket Applications, our Third Party Partners’ mobile applications, and our websites. Our Services and our Third Party Partners may also collect data using technology such as cookies, ad tags, and pixels. Web beacons are invisibly embedded electronic images and are about the size of the period at the end of this sentence. We use cookies to store this type of information when we serve ads onto Internet browsers. For more information about cookies and web beacons, please visit: http://www.allaboutcookies.org/cookies/. Some of our partners send us information directly via a “server to server” file instead of using web technologies like cookies, web beacons or pixels. We also collect mobile advertising identifiers (IDFA for Apple devices or AAID for Android devices), third party proprietary identifiers, ad exposure information such as URL, site name, creative, publisher, and channel, precise geolocation information, session information, operating system, internet protocol address (IP address), hashed email address and device model. All of these technologies help us to deliver relevant ads, provide ad measurement and reporting, and to generate market insights.

Information from Third Party Sources

We may also collect information about you and your device from third party sources including public databases, social media platforms, data append services, third party marketing partners, data brokers, and others. The information we collect from third party sources may include categories such as demographic information and commercial information. We combine this third party data with the personal information that we have collected.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: 4. Opt-out of Ad Targeting – Your Choice Mechanisms\n\nInMarket offers consumers the ability to opt-out of our use of your information to serve personalized ads to you across devices, mobile applications, and websites. If you don’t want the information we collect used for the purpose of serving you such personalized ads, we offer a number of choice mechanisms. Please note that none of our choice mechanisms will opt you out of all advertising. You will continue to receive generic ads but they won’t be targeted by us and we will remove opted out browsers or devices from our ad targeting system. Your opt-out choice will be applied only to the browser or device that has opted out.
Label: Description of Right to Limit use of PI
Categories of Personal Information Sold
Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: To submit a request please email us at privacy@inmarket.com, or call us toll-free at 1 (888) 506-4042. We may take additional steps to verify your identity before sharing personal information in response to a request.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: CCPA: Right to Delete\nYou have the right to request that we delete your personal information, subject to certain exceptions.
Label: Description of Right to Delete

Text: To submit a request to delete your personal information, you may complete this Delete My Personal Information form or email us at privacy@inmarket.com.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: To opt-out, you may complete this Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information form, click on the “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information” link provided on our websites and in our applications, or email us at privacy@inmarket.com. Alternatively, scroll up to the Section of this Privacy Policy entitled “Opt Out of Ad Targeting – Your Choice Mechanisms” for additional opt-out mechanisms you may choose.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: CCPA: Right to Correct Inaccurate Personal Information\nYou have the right to correct any inaccuracies in your personal information.
Label: Description of Right to Correct Information

Text: Please email us at privacy@inmarket.com and indicate you are a California resident who wishes to correct your personal information, and provide a written explanation, together with supporting evidence as applicable, setting out (1) what inaccurate information InMarket possesses, and (2) the corrected version of this information.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: If you wish to exercise your rights under the CCPA, please call us toll-free at 1 (888) 506-4042, email your request to privacy@inmarket.com, or complete the relevant form: Business Contacts – Delete My Personal Information or Business Contacts – Opt-Out of Sharing My Personal Information
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: InMarket does not sell such personal information but we may use it for marketing or promotional materials and share it with third parties for this purpose.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Sold

Text: Right to Nondiscrimination\nWe will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your CCPA rights.
Label: Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

Text: Effective Date: December 29, 2022
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: 17. Modifications\n\nWe reserve the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time. If we make any material changes, we will notify you by placing a prominent notice on our website and/or via the InMarket Applications. Any changes will be effective immediately upon the posting of the revised Privacy Policy and your subsequent use of our website, the InMarket Applications, or any third party mobile application that integrates our Services indicates your consent to the Privacy Policy posted at the time of use.
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text:
Security. To protect, defend or investigate potential violations of the Terms of Use for our websites, the InMarket Applications, or third party applications that integrate our Services. We may also use such information to protect privacy, security, safety, rights, property, and to prevent fraud. 

Legal Compliance. We may use and disclose personal information that we collect to comply with any applicable law or regulation. We also use the personal information we collect to comply with legal process, including subpoenas and search warrants.
Label: Description of Right to Delete

Text:
4. Opt-out of Ad Targeting – Your Choice Mechanisms

InMarket offers consumers the ability to opt-out of our use of your information to serve personalized ads to you across devices, mobile applications, and websites
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: To exercise this opt-out, please visit the privacy settings of your Android or iOS device and select “limit ad tracking” (Apple iOS) or “opt-out of interest based ads” (Android).
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: You may limit ad tracking on many CTV/OTT devices; your device manufacturer may provide instructions for updating ad tracking settings. The NAI provides additional information on opting out on CTV/OTT devices and instructions for updating privacy preferences of many such devices at Connected TV Choices.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: InMarket does not collect data through CTV/OTT streaming devices, but some data we collect may be used to target ads on CTV/OTT devices. You may limit ad tracking on many CTV/OTT devices; your device manufacturer may provide instructions for updating ad tracking settings. The NAI provides additional information on opting out on CTV/OTT devices and instructions for updating privacy preferences of many such devices at Connected TV Choices.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: Hashed Personally Identifiable Information. Consumers who wish to opt out of the use of hashed PII for interest-based advertising should visit the Digital Advertising Alliance’s AdChoices token opt-out page to submit a request.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: In the CheckPoints mobile application, consumers can earn points redeemable in a rewards program in exchange for various activities such as sharing precise geolocation information (for example, by visiting a retail location), scanning product barcodes in a retail location, sharing purchase records, taking surveys, and sharing personal information such as name and email address

Text: Minors and Children\n\nOur Services are intended for general adult audiences and are not intended for children. We do not knowingly collect, store, or sell the personal information of children who are under 16 years of age. If you believe we have collected such information, please contact us immediately at privacy@inmarket.com.

Text:
Information from You

You may provide information manually while using our Services, for example, by typing your name and email address or by using a social profile to register for or update an account in one of the InMarket Applications. Some InMarket Applications invite you to link to your banking or payment card accounts and your retail shopping accounts (such as your online store user account or a store loyalty account). We also collect personal information when you communicate with us for support or any other reason or when you register for a promotion.

Information from our Services

Our Services may collect personal information through the InMarket Applications, our Third Party Partners’ mobile applications, and our websites. Our Services and our Third Party Partners may also collect data using technology such as cookies, ad tags, and pixels. Web beacons are invisibly embedded electronic images and are about the size of the period at the end of this sentence. We use cookies to store this type of information when we serve ads onto Internet browsers. For more information about cookies and web beacons, please visit: http://www.allaboutcookies.org/cookies/. Some of our partners send us information directly via a “server to server” file instead of using web technologies like cookies, web beacons or pixels. We also collect mobile advertising identifiers (IDFA for Apple devices or AAID for Android devices), third party proprietary identifiers, ad exposure information such as URL, site name, creative, publisher, and channel, precise geolocation information, session information, operating system, internet protocol address (IP address), hashed email address and device model. All of these technologies help us to deliver relevant ads, provide ad measurement and reporting, and to generate market insights.

Information from Third Party Sources

We may also collect information about you and your device from third party sources including public databases, social media platforms, data append services, third party marketing partners, data brokers, and others. The information we collect from third party sources may include categories such as demographic information and commercial information. We combine this third party data with the personal information that we have collected.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Mobile OS Opt-Out. We honor the mobile device settings for Android and Apple iOS devices. To exercise this opt-out, please visit the privacy settings of your Android or iOS device and select “limit ad tracking” (Apple iOS) or “opt-out of interest based ads” (Android). For devices where we see that such a selection has been made, we will not use information collected from that device to deliver re-targeted advertising.
(b) Mobile Location Choices. If you’d like to adjust your setting regarding the use of precise geolocation information by third parties such as InMarket, you may do so via the privacy settings on your device. This can either be done globally across all apps by turning off Location Services, or for specific apps. Mobile applications that collect precise geolocation information typically offer mechanisms in the operating system settings to control the collection and use of precise geolocation information. Please note that these choice mechanisms won’t impact previously collected precise geolocation information.
(c) Connected TV/Over the Top Streaming (“CTV/OTT”). InMarket does not collect data through CTV/OTT streaming devices, but some data we collect may be used to target ads on CTV/OTT devices. You may limit ad tracking on many CTV/OTT devices; your device manufacturer may provide instructions for updating ad tracking settings. The NAI provides additional information on opting out on CTV/OTT devices and instructions for updating privacy preferences of many such devices at Connected TV Choices.
(d) Hashed Personally Identifiable Information. Consumers who wish to opt out of the use of hashed PII for interest-based advertising should visit the Digital Advertising Alliance’s AdChoices token opt-out page to submit a request.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: InMarket offers financial incentives to consumers in exchange for the consumer sharing certain personal information with us through websites and mobile applications we own, such as CheckPoints.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: We collect and use the information we obtain through the InMarket Applications to further our business in accordance with our Privacy Policy. We offer an incentive to consumers who provide us with information through the InMarket Applications because it allows us to gain insights into consumer trends and habits. We value the information a consumer provides us through the InMarket Applications as equal to the value of the reward that we provide for sharing the information. InMarket receives a nominal fee for certain completed surveys in the CheckPoints mobile application, which is the basis upon which we value this CheckPoints survey information. Regarding the rest of the data for which we offer an incentive in the InMarket Applications, one consumer’s data has nominal value to us because in large data sets that also include data collected without incentive, the utility and value of the set is only nominally enhanced by the inclusion of one additional entry.\n\nTo participate in any of these incentive-based offers you can opt-in by intentionally sharing the required information through the InMarket Applications.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: You can opt-out of participation in any of our incentive-based offers at any time. If you wish to opt-out, stop submitting additional information and please submit a “Do Not Sell My Personal Information” request or a “Delete My Personal Information” request as described below this Privacy Policy. You may also delete the mobile application.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: For certain requests, we may need you to provide additional information to verify your request, such as providing additional personal information so that we can verify your identity. We will not use such information for any purpose besides handling your request.

Text: You may designate an authorized agent to make a request on your behalf in certain circumstances. The designation must be in writing and your agent must be registered with the California Secretary of State.

Text: Contact Us\n\nIf you would like more information or have questions about this Privacy Policy or how we or our service providers treat your personal information, or to submit a request to exercise your rights under applicable laws, please contact us at privacy@inmarket.com or at 1 (888) 506-4042.
Label: Methods to exercise rights
